Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: LaurenM-86
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Locanda Salieri with my boyfriend. We were very pleased to find it very easily from the main bus station, on a really pretty canal. We were greeted by a very friendly lady who spoke good english and soon found it to be a really lovely family run hotel. It is very reasonably priced for Venice and it is not far from the main attractions, we like to walk around to take in the sights anyway but it is only 20min walk from St Mark's Square and many other pretty sights. The restaurants around Santa Croce were much nicer, more local and cheaper too! I don't know what people are complaining about or what people expect - the family were very welcoming and the rooms very clean. We stayed in room 12 at the top and although tt wasn't the biggest room i've stayed in, what do you need a big room for when you're exploring all day!!! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return when we go back to Venice - it is a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: Dufflepod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6 years ago. Pleased to say the hotel was exactly the same as I remembered it when I returned last week Clean, friendly, budget Locanda a few minutes away from Piazzale Roma. Continental Breakfast is included in the price ( at the Ribo restaurant next door), which is more than adequate. I can recommend Bacareto Da Lele, a tiny bar literally around the corner ( turn right out of the hotel) for a cheap glass of wine or spritz served with tasty rolls or cicheti in the evening. Also Campo Santa Margherita fringed with bars and restaurants is only a 5 minute stroll away in the neighbouring sestiere of Dorsoduro. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location for short trip”
Reviews.Author: melll6
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving city by train, it is a perfect location. 5 minutes walk to train station, bus terminal and vaporetto. So you don't have to carry your luggage through the streets. You can walk to the Piazza San Marco and also you can take vaporetto. Both of them should be done in order to discover Venice. Rooms with canal view makes you feel the atmosphere of Venice, besides the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Newhook
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes walk from Piazzala De Roma (bus terminal), which is great because you don't want to drag a suitcase through the streets off Venice very far or pay for an expensive water taxi. Also very easy to find. Great price for Venice as well, plenty of great restaurants in the area (be sure to have the mussells at Trattoria Ai Tre Ponti Di Trevisan nearby ......the best in Venice!) Our room was clean, but small, but this is normal for Venice and Europe in general. Breakfast was good, with a nice selection. Staff were friendly and helpful. Easy to walk to all Venice's main attractions from here. Overall I'd recommend it, especially for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “From a student solo traveler's point of view”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice during the low season (mid-December) and I was attracted to its price and location. Ideally I didn't want to sleep in a dorm with others and it was not easy to find a cheap single room, but this hotel had it. The location is fantastic, very near to Piazalle Roma bus station and having arrived after the sky turned dark, finding the hotel was not hard at all. True, it was far from the main attractions but actually walking to San Marco only took me 30 minutes, not a big deal for me. Being away also means lower price; I especially like how it was near to the San Margherita Square, which was a student hang out area with cheaper food. The interior is cosy and clean. My room is on the 3rd floor with no elevator but it doesn't matter for me as I travel lightly. I didn't get the room with the canal view but that's fine too since I'm out all day. I got a double bed for a single room all by myself! The toilet was complete as well. But I especially appreciate the free WiFi in the room: very fast connection, and great for a quick research before heading out! Staff speaks good English and are friendly too. One day the toilet light did not work and they fixed it promptly after I told them. Restaurant next door's breakfast was decent, nothing special but good enough for me, I'm not a luxury traveler after all and breakfast provided means at least I don't need to hunt for something to eat with a hungry stomach. Further down the hotel there is a pastry shop that sells a good variety of pastries if the breakfast is not enough, and it is featured in my LonelyPlanet guide too. Overall, great little hotel, wouldn't really mind to stay there again! p/s: They received a certificate from Trip Advisor as one of the better hotels too! It was in Italian so I can't really understand it but it has got stars on it and the word Excellent so you get what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but decently priced (by Venice standards)”
Reviews.Author: JJYTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the Piazzala De Roma and the train station (just across the grand canal). There are many restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. We were lucky enough to get one of the largest rooms, which had a queen bed and a single bed. The breakfast was basic but edible and there was free wifi available. The downside was that there was mould and hair in the shower and the air conditioner was not working (even though the front desk person said it would be). The front desk staff can all communicate adequately in English, which was a definite plus for us given we speak zero Italian! It was a little loud at times (the restaurant is right next door and we were woken quite early). We had a little trouble booking online and paying with credit card but after a few emails we sorted it out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, awful customer service (rooms are ok)”
Reviews.Author: jetsetgo27
Reviews.Content: OK, let me begin with the pros: short walk from the train station, and room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. nice breakfast included in the rent. overall, great value for the 105 euros we paid for a double. I was all set to write a nice review by the evening of my first day's stay which is when someone at the front desk (Let's call him Guy#1) decided to have some fun with our passports. Earlier in the day we had handed over our passports to another guy (Guy#2) at the front desk for safekeeping (BAD idea, we should have kept it with us). When we came back at night, Guy#1 tells us he can't find our passports and that front desk is not supposed to hold on to them. He makes a show of searching and spoke to someone on the phone for a while in italian (maybe he wanted to get Guy#2 in trouble) I'm in panic mode because we are leaving tomorrow from Venice. Guy#1 says get some sleep, you'll have it tomorrow. I didn't understand how, but the next morning, the manager was at the front desk and we told him our problem. He immediately made some calls, we could hear him next door screaming and yelling at someone (at Guy#1, I guess) after which Guy#1 comes back, takes our passports from the front desk MAIN drawer (!!!) and sheepishly hands it over to us. I'm giddy with anger and relief by now when I realize they were at the front desk the whole time!! Maybe what we had was a random experience, but we're never going back there. It's a pity because except for this, our stay at this hotel was rather unremarkable in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: PedroSheratonPorto
Reviews.Content: Small and friendly hotel, with very friendly staff... I have stayed for 3 nights and the location itÂ´s just great, near the train station (5 mints), St. Marco Square and all the atraccions... Bar and restaurant just next door... With lucky you can have a room with a view to the canal in front of the hotel, that makes better your venice experience... Breakfast is in the restaurant next door, and itÂ´s more than enough to start the day with local products... Overall for the price you pay you have a 5 star experience, and when I return to venice this my place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Snowgooose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a ten minute walk from the station and a five minute walk from the Grand Canal. We had a clean smallish room with a small balcony on the first floor. The staff were very helpful particularly with a small problem we encountered while on holiday. We had dinner in the restaurant downstairs and it was very good. The hotel was in easy walking distance of the vaporreta.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: keith123England
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time on Trip Advisor finding a suitable hotel as there are so many and the costs are high in Venice.We got what we expected at Locanda Salieri. The location was away from the crowds but within easy reach of the sites.We had an attic room which was small but clean.The a/c was not as cold as would have wished but was adequate.The stairs up to the 3rd floor are a bit of an effort.The breakfast next door was standard continental. However we were made aware of these facts from previous reviews so there were no nasty surprises,and we were very happy with the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: Tag_Beak
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a perfect location if you are arriving by bus at Pzl Roma - one street and about a 5 min walk from the bus. Its also well located for walking to the main tourist areas (with a map). Room - we had a canal view room, balcony was tiny, barely room for two people, but the view was good, although its a relatively quiet canal in front of the hotel, in terms of boat traffic, gondolas, etc. The room was quite small and very basic, but clean. Air con was OK. Breakfast - very basic and minimal. You could help yourself to coffee, orange juice, ham and cornflakes but just one croissant and one bread roll each were brought to your table, these items were not help yourself, which I thought was quite poor given what we had paid to stay at the hotel (270 Euro for 2 nights). Staff - all staff that we spoke to were very friendly. Very close to the hotel is Campo Santa Margherita, which is a large square with many bars and restaurants, the square comes alive in the evening, a good place to have a few glasses of spritz. There are some nice little bars and restaurants near the hotel, turn left out of the door and follow the street, we didnt eat in the restaurant below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: editonno
Reviews.Content: Many hotels in Venice were very expensive or required a two night minimum. We found this to be the best value. It had a great location, near the train station and away from the crowds. The breakfast next door left something to be desired but we didn't focus on it. We were on the 3rd floor and the room was a decent size and clean. My only issue was that the bathroom faucet handles were so stripped that you had a hard time turning them off and on. The hotel staff was polite and allowed us to keep our luggage in storage the next day while we waited for our night train. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: xibatian
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, good location, best breakfast next door!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: SashaSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a trip to Venice. Staff was friendly and helpful. I did not have computer with me but there was one in the hotel lobby that I could use to check e-mail. The location was great; about 15 minute walk to St. Marks. My room was very clean and nicely decorated. The AC worked pretty well; did not go quite as cool as I might have liked but I was still perfectly comfortable at night ( and I am picky about this). Very good breakfast in the hotel next door with rolls, croissants, ham and cereals. Comfortable double bed as well! The only thing I did notice was the music from the restaurant next door. I was up high enough that it was really just pretty background music for me and did not keep me up but for someone on a lower floor it might be a problem ( I think it stopped by about 11:30). Excellent value for your dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic...”
Reviews.Author: LachniFranz
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location,few steps from Piazzale Roma.The room that we got was on the attic,was very small and basic,didn`t have refrigirator but hey,we thought,we`ll wander the streets whole day-we`ll be in the room just to take a sleep.But the problem was when you get back from the whole day walking on the heat and moisture(it`s july)and you want to rest a bit in a climatised room,what was not possible-the airconditining was,gently said-poor...old air-con system in the room that didn`t help at all.I can speak for my room on the 3rd floor only,so avoid those rooms! The breakfast was ok,the staff kind and polite.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanion5
Reviews.Content: locanda hotel is small but great value for venice. it is well placed for the cruise terminal, just ten minutes walking from roma. the food was good, the room was good and the people where very helpful , what more can you want.. we really loved it and hope we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: lenuccio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable (except for no elevator) and in a lovely spot. Though convenient to trains, vaporettos, buses, it is far enough away to be in an uncrowded and charming neighborhood. There is a good, moderately priced restaurant (antico gafaro) a short distance to the left as you leave the hotel (opposite an osteria), and a better, more pricey restaurant to the right (Al Ponte) with the red canopies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lindamichelle1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while in Venice. very nice hotel, was run by a very friendly man, he was very sweet and came to the restraunt the next day to wish me a happy birthday. (it had my bday on my passport) Breakfast was nice, in a little restraunt next door to the hotel. Wasnt much food, but i noticed the whole time i was in Italy they dont give much for breakfast. Was very close to the bus station and train station. Venice was beautiful and would love to go there again someday, would definitly consider staying here again. Only negative was that we were on the top floor and there is no lift haha, so we had to lug our big suitcase up the stairs. but thats no problem at all. the room was very nice and clean and quiet. Also the hotel had a deal with going for a gondola ride with the only female gondolier in Venice and we took the deal and had a brilliant time, she was amazing and very interesting hearing all the history. Definitly book in with the hotel to go with her if you stay here you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: PossumJr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in the hotel less than a month ago. Very nice reception staff, great location close to the train station, and clean / renovated room. Breakfast also features quality coffee in the restaurant next door, which appears to be under the same ownership umbrella. Not even sure how we happened across the hotel since it's not one of the higher ranked (yet) in Venice, but we felt completely comfortable here. Won't even bother looking at another location when we return to Venice in the future. One side note: it is a bit of a hike to St. Mark's Square, but well worth exploring side streets along the way. Ask about the local bar within a block or so that sells wine for 1 Euro / glass.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in good location”
Reviews.Author: dm1999
Reviews.Content: Good value in good location. The place had a good size bed. It was away from all the crazy fast paced touristy area. You felt you had this charming city to yourself and a couple more people.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: minacharm
Reviews.Content: I had a thoroughly enjoyable time in Venice and the hotel was no exception to this. I was in room 1 with a garden view. I'd read from posters on here that it could be noisy so I packed earplugs - however I didn't need them - things were quiet by 11pm. My case was carried up the stairs when I arrived and taken down when I left (perhaps as I was a solo female). I was invited to leave my case for the day before my flight - I didn't even have to ask! The room was clean and comfortable, with a place for everything. There was always hot water in the shower, you just had to wait a little while for it to come through. Free wifi saved a lot on calls and having the net was so convenient. The breakfast was a decent continental - a treat for me to eat croissant every morning! I had a drink in the restaurant but when I went for food it was too busy, so book in advance - the food looks and smells great! Finally, the location near Piazzale Roma is excellent, two bridges and you're there! A lovely place - I would definitely go back ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: systemic_rebel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days, and were very satisfied. The rooms are clean, and in a quiet part of the city. The receptionists can't all speak english, but that was not a big problem. The prices are also quite low for a hotel in Venice. The hotel has a good location and is near the trainstation and Piazzale Roma. All in all a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: TaraR09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, the staff were very welcoming and I had booked ahead to eat at the restaurant as it was my partners birthday. We were travelling by train and it was a short 5 minute walk from the train station. Room was small but comfortable and had a large bed. We paid extra for a canal view, however although we were facing the canal we were on the top floor and could only see rooftops. It wasnt really a problem for us as we were only staying one night but I would have been disappointed if we had been staying longer. Breakfast was in the restaurant next door, it was simple continental mainly bread and cheeses and fresh coffee and tea. We had access to free WiFi where we were given a password to use, this was really useful to us when planning our days ahead. Staff were friendly and helpful we were able to leave our bags at the hotel until late in the evening as we had a night train to catch which meant we could explore the city without all our luggage. Great location, excellent service would recommend the restauarant Ribot too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service & Good Location !”
Reviews.Author: Lortiz5
Reviews.Content: I reall y like the locanda salieri staff was great and very helpful . also has a great location near to the train terminal which it was very convenient. Great places nearby to go eat etc.... i definitely recommend this hotel ! *btw price was ok compare to other hotels in venice .

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel.. They double charge my credit card..”
Reviews.Author: owlnight
Reviews.Content: I would like to warn fellow traveller that this hotel double charge my credit card when I received my bill back home. We were traveling from Austria to Swiss to Italy and had book at this hotel on the 26Dec for 2night. But when we check our bill, it show that we had also book 18Dec which we didnt as we were in Austria, Innsbruck, on that date. The bank had even told us that that the hotel had send them the credit cards receipt of both date; one signed, one none. Currently we are pursuing in legal way together with our bank on this matter as it show that our credit card was misuse by this hotel. So do check your bill when you are back home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: huangclaire
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very friendly staff. Nice and clean room. They have restaurant next door the place you have breakfast, but we didn't go for lunch and dinner. We had so wonderful time staying in the hotel and definitely will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just off the main street, no frills, hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: socaljsb
Reviews.Content: Locanda Salieri can be difficult to find, it's just off the main street with the entrance located in a small courtyard. It's about a 15 minute walk from the train station and another 15-20 mins to PIazza San Marco. The hotel itself is off the main street which makes it feel like a hidden gem. The room my wife and I had was accessed via a door in the lobby/breakfast room, which made it feel somewhat less private, although it never was an issue. The room itself was split into the upper living area with the bathroom on the lower level. The room was not fancy by any means, but it was comfortable and well located. The staff was friendly and more than willing to help out. Breakfast was your standard issue european spread (cold cuts, croissants, danishes, juice, coffee, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “A positive part of our Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: So_much_to_see084
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near train and bus stations and a main Vaporetto stop... and just far enough away from the busyness and noise of the Grand Canal. But on a canal nonetheless - which our room with tiny balcony overlooked... a great spot for observing life and the odd gondola go by. The room was compact; the bathroom spacious and modern. Breakfast next door (included in the price) at Ristorante Ribot was nothing special. But we took advantage of our hotel discount there for dinner - one of our more memorable meals, served in a lovely courtyard and garden by a genial host who was mater of his art. We felt more a part of the "real" Venice exploring near this hotel. Staff was most helpful. For us, an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Acordts
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed 2 nights with my wife and we loved the view and location. From the rail station you must use two bridges to reach the hotel, itÂ´s easy, but first study the map. The "taxi" is quite expensive, 50 euros for just 400 meters, so go walking. IÂ´ve been there in november, flood season, so the water arrives the hotel during two hours in the morning, but IÂ´s not a big deal if you leave the hotel before 8h. And for me this was part of the show. ThereÂ´s free wireless internet and the staff is also very friendly! I recommend, but book the room with canal view (IÂ´ve stayed in the room nÂº 7).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very helpful staff, lovely views. Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: heatherwil
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice at around 11pm, tired and hungry. Hoping for a glass of wine and a bite to eat, we asked the man on reception if the restaurant next door was still open. It wasn't, but he had a word with the owner and he welcomed us in. We had a delicious meal and really appreciated the hotel staff going the extra mile. Located a 2-minute walk from the bus stop Piazzale Roma, the hotel is easy to find and perfect for arriving late in the evening as we did. Our room was clean and charmingly furnished with traditional furniture. The bathroom was compact but well-equipped, and the shower was lovely and hot. I found the bed very comfortable and, although there was some noise from outside, had an excellent night's sleep. The free wi-fi was an added bonus. We would definitely return to the hotel and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: harmul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after cruise from Venice Excellent location for cruise terminal & for exploring Venice Basic hotel but good value for money by Venice standards The attached Ribot Restaurant is superb The Tolentini canal runs outside the front of the hotel in a busy, lively area

Reviews.Title: “Unable to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: mserges
Reviews.Content: There is a restaurant on the ground floor allways karaoke and terrible singing at night. So if you prefer not to sleep all your nights in beautiful Venice this hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kjw2010
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy walk from train station on arrival and to grand canal for ferry to Piazza San Marco. We had a canal room with a view and within a few minutes of arrival had a gondola pass our window with the gondolier singing! Breakfast at restaurant next door which also had such nice meals and service that we had 2 dinners there. Small room and small bathroom, but if you don't mind that then the benefits out-weigh that, providing such good value in other ways. No lift, so had to climb narrow stairway.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfull experience...”
Reviews.Author: Paska57
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to parking at arrival of Venice. Silent at night. Front of the Canal to listen to Gondola singers. Close to Rialto and Piazza de San Marco. Staff...only have that kind of attention on 5 star hotels if that so,. Friendly and very atencious staff for all my needs and inquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent place”
Reviews.Author: AandMLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: The downsides: small room, hard bed, super noisy, tiny shower, had to go sit by the front desk to get the wifi to work. However, all but the last were the same for almost all the hotels we stayed in during our 3 week trip. Rooms were basic but clean and the breakfast was decent (although at the next door restaurant which for us was not an issue). Nicely close to the railway station so we didn't have to schlep our bags on a boat or walk them forever. We didn't stay much at the hotel so for us basic was fine and considering the prices in Venice it was a great value. We were somewhat disappointed in Venice in general- if you had to make choices on where to go you might consider skipping Venice and spending more time in Tuscany, Rome, or Florence or perhaps getting out to the Cinque Terre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a very good position to see all of Venice”
Reviews.Author: JB1958_10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home early hours of this morning after 3 nights in Venice via Treviso (Ryanair). The Locanda Salieri was very close to Piazzale Roma, a couple of minutes walk and only about 4 bridges away, so no need for water taxis etc. We had a room with a garden view, all very clean, modernised and well kept. Helpful staff and continental breakfast at restaurant next door. If we ever visit Venice again, this would be our choice of hotel to stay in and we certainly would recommend to friends etc. We had a Gondola Ride with Alex (female Gondolier) and a bottle of champagne. About 20 minutes into the experience, we had a awful storm, thunder, lightning, hailstones, rain - so sat with an umbrella over us - this was a trip that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean hotel on the edge of Venice”
Reviews.Author: skyloadblue
Reviews.Content: This is a basic but very clean hotel on the edge of Venice near the station. We booked here because of the competitive price. The bed is comfortable, and the breakfast which comes with the room is basic but plentiful. Rooms are cleaned everyday and this included clean sheets and towels. We had room 4 with a canal view and I highly recommend this so as to get the most out of Venice. Also the room is small so its nice to have a balcony as it helps make the room feel a little bit bigger. The restaurants near the hotel are not very good. When you go out the hotel door turn left and keep walking, go over 2 bridges and you should find yourself in another district with a better choice of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Fantastic Breakfast - Full Package”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_SP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find taking only 5 minutes from the car park and with all our luggage was much appreciated. It is surrounded by some very beautiful areas that I am not sure we would have found if we had stayed further into Venice and was perfect for exploring and getting to grips with at first what seems like a maze of streets and soon becomes very easy to understand after 2 days of enless walking. The hotel being a little further out from San Marco was perfect for exploring some of the more traditional family run and cheaper restaurants and was also close to the local univertsity and so the night life in the local square was buzzing and very enjoyable. The hotel itself was lovely, clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was lovely and always fresh as it is served in their own restaurant next door to the hotel. On problem was that the canal was a little busy and in the mornings there is a lot of hussle of bussle, however, it's also very exciting to hear everything going on around you and understanding the city a little more. Although, I wouldn't have changed having the canal view for anything. The walls of the hotel were also a little thin and we could hear the room next door's tv on quite late. There is currently building work going on across the canal from the hotel and so some of the noise was due to that, but i cannot image that going on for too long. Overall, wonderful experience and a city well worth a visit. Would definately use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly family run little hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mayhew9
Reviews.Content: Set in the nicest part of Venice, away from the tourist crowds, close to lots of bars and eating places and the lively student atmosphere of San Pantalon and Campo Santa Magherita, and only 5 minutes' walk away from the Piazzale Roma airport bus terminal and the station, there couldn't be a better location. The room was beautifully clean, with a sparkling modern bathroom complete with hairdryer. There was free WiFi, and our room had a small balcony overlooking the beautiful Tolentini canal, a grandstand view of Venetian life. Breakfast was in the stylish Ribo restaurant below, which also offered a discount on their very interesting a la carte dinner menu.The personnel couldn't have been nicer, and even sent me up hot water and lemon when I had a stomach upset! Fantastic value for money. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “great value for canal front room”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGolightly
Reviews.Content: conveniently located within easy walk of bus station (it cost us 2.50EURO per person to get from the airport to the hotel) and vaporatto stop (it was very easy to get around venice without having to pay grand canal accommodation rates). small rooms, but clean and quiet. no lift so try to pack light! nice basic breakfast included in room rate (fresh bread, croissant, cereal, coffee, tea, fruit juice). would definintely stay here again. although this was the cheapest hotel we stayed in during our 5 week trip, my husband liked it the most because of the great location and general atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstandingly good! Made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: triphelp555
Reviews.Content: This small place was from the booking, the first contact via telephone and internet to the moment we left the perfect place to stay in Venice. The location, the service, the friendly staff, the rooms and equipment, etc. everything as it should be. Sure the breakfast could be improved, but we got all we needed. We used three double rooms, and all were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on canal for short stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: vavania
Reviews.Content: Good location near bus stop, on a canal - if you spend couple nights in Venice. For longer stay it's better to choose something nearer to San Marko. Very poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Sofia
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay in. We were in a room with a canal view. The only thing I would recommend is more attention on the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to see Venice -and good value too”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this small hotel several times. It's very convenient for the bus & rail stations and on a pleasant local canal behind the church of the Tolentini. It's been upgraded and is clean and tidy. Rooms are small but they have good en-suite bathrooms. Staff are pleasant and helpful and there's 24 hour reception. There are good restaurants and bars near by but I'd recommend eating at the Ribo' restaurant next door which is associated with the hotel and where a very good 'continental' breakfast is taken. Venice isn't cheap to stay in but the Salieri offers as good a deal as you'll find in Venice. While it's a stone's throw from the bus station, it's only four or five minutes walk from the Frari, 15 mins. from Accademia and St Marks can be walked in less than half an hour. It's off the tourist routes and generally quiet. Some 'local' areas - eg: Campo S Margherita, are near by and make a refreshing change from the manic Rialto and San Marco honey traps. To sum up; it's a charming hotel very well located. If you're staying you can have rooms overlooking the canal on the Fondamenta Minotto or the garden overlooking the Tolentini church at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location but pretty bare bones”
Reviews.Author: Bubba064
Reviews.Content: I appreciated how convenient this place is to the bus and train stations. It is on a nice canal with good restaurants nearby. The breakfast is quite respectable. My problems with this place was 1) the tiny size of the room -- with two people it would have been almost intolerable, and 2) the hairs and other dirt on the floors and in the sink. Don't they use vacuum cleaners?

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: ogurel59
Reviews.Content: People who want to stay in a Venice hotel should minimize their expectations. If you are not looking for a huge room with all kind of amenities/services included, Hotel Locanda Salieri is the best choice to stay. The cleanliness of the room and the location is absolutely excellent. It is only a five minutes walk from the train station and bus/vaporetto stops. The breakfast was the most simple breakfast I've ever had in an European hotel but also the most enjoyable one because of the place (Ristorante Ribot next to the hotel's entrance). You can (and should) have your lunch and/or dinner at the same place with 10% discount as a hotel guest and believe me you won't regret. The prices, quality of food and service is spectacular and you can have your meal together with locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Saska2n
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a couple of blocks from the parking lot. It is a 20 min walk to San Marco but the value is great. Clean, air conditioned rooms, ours overlooked the small canal at Fondamento Minotta. We also booked the Gondola ride with Alexandra and found the package deal to be great value. The only amenity is the restaurant next door that provides breakfast. Book this hotel if you are looking for good value and don't mind the walk to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel located in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Al_Jolie
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this hotel for 3 nights. The bedroom was clean and quiet with a bathroom in it, a TV and a big bed. Then, the breakfast was included in the price and was generous: Corn flakes, orange juice, tea, coffee, croissant, bread...! The staff was very helpful and kind=> if you need an information they help you. As a conclusion, this hotel is perfect for little budgets!! And it is located just near the Piazzale Roma where you cn take the train, the bus and the Vaporetto. It's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal !”
Reviews.Author: fraire
Reviews.Content: An ideally situated hotel for those arriving into Piazzale Roma, just a couple of minutes' walk away. The neighbourhood is excellent if you don't need or want to be right in the middle of the tourist scene. In any case, nothing is really very far in Venice, especially if you get a Vaporetto pass. The hotel itself is classed as a 1 star, but our room was surprisingly well-equipped : (very)large double bed ; AC plus programmable fan, which we used more; (very) small bathroom with adequate sized shower and even a hair-dryer ; plenty of wardrobe space ; table and chair. Being an 'economy' room on the 3rd floor, we had no real view as such, only some rooftops, but who cares when you can step outside and be right in the heart of it ... The hotel is not luxurious like the Sofitel round the corner, but it is spotlessly clean and the staff are welcoming and pleasantly unobtrusive. As we arrived quite late on our first evening (10:30 p.m), we tried our luck at the adjoining Ribo' restaurant, and had a lovely meal in their secluded garden, despite the fact that we arrived just after their normal serving hours. The service was as charming as the place itself, and the prices incredibly reasonable for Venice - another advantage to being off the beaten track. In fact the Ribo' is the place where guests have their breakfast, which is included in the price of the room, and is perfectly adequate to start the day off, even if the first morning's coffee was slightly too watered down for our 'ristretto' loving tastes. All in all a fantastic option for people on a tighter budget, or even for those who are not looking for luxury. It's clean, quiet, well-situated and welcoming. A final special thanks to the night concierge who graciuosly got out of his bed to give us a wake up call at 5:15 a.m so we could catch our bus to Treviso airport. Grazie mille to all at the Locanda Salieri and the Ribo'.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet and authentic Venice Hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Ardy53
Reviews.Content: We had booked at this small hotel for one night before embarking on a 12 night cruise of the Mediterranean. It was chosen carefully with budget, charm and location in mind. We were not disappointed based on any of these three criteria. The room was not large, yet we managed to fit 4 suitcases into it and the bathroom was funtional with a good shower. We were on the first floor and admittedly the stairs are a little steep, but certainly not unmanageable. There was a great view from the bedroom overlooking a quiet canal - great to be away from the hectic activity of the larger canals. Breakfast was delightful in the covered garden of the adjoining restaurant, with cereal, croissants, rolls, ham, cheese and jams, all of this washed down with several cups of great coffee. Best of all - it was included in the price. The staff were very helpful and we would certainly recommend this hotel. A full review of our other experiences in Venice and our cruise can be read at www.freewebs.com/med-review.

Reviews.Title: “Unfavourable location for the sights & dreadful customer service!”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyHJ
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights accommodation at Locanda Salieri's sister hotel albergo San Samuele. However, when we arrived at the hotel they couldn't find our booking and it transpired that although their booking office had sent us an email confirmation, they had not put it into their booking system. Despite this, the hotel staff failed to apologise and left us standing around for around 40 minutes whilst they called their sister hotels deciding which rooms to offer us instead. They finally offered us a room at their sister B&B Locanda Salieri, promising us that we would have a canal view & that the rooms & location were much better. When we arrived at the other hotel Locanda Salieri, we were told that oh no, there were no rooms available with a canal view. So, it's not clear who was lying - the staff at San Samuele or the staff at Locanda Salieri. We were very disappointed with the location because we wanted to be near San Marco, not the train station. This meant that we spent much more time travelling to and from the hotel than we would otherwise have needed to. The receptionist was so unhelfpul and basically kept changing his story whenever we challenged his answers. We wanted to negotiate a discount but the receptionist refused to let us speak to the manager and kept telling us that it wasn't his business because we made the booking at the other hotel - even though the hotels are sister hotels and share a booking office. Finally he actually called the manager in front of us but refused to let us speak to her and then he pretended he couldn't find the number to call her again. When we negotiated a discount with the manager on the phone, the receptionist refused to put it in writing. Eventually we forced him to write the new rate down on the booking sheet in front of us. However, he wrote this in pencil. When we came back down the next morning there was a new member of staff on reception and she told us that we had to change rooms for the second night (despite the fact we'd been told we'd be in the same room for 2 nights) and we noticed that the price for our room was written down as the full price again. When we challenged her, she said that oh, there was no price written there so she didn't know about the discount, which means that the receptionist the night before had rubbed out the price we had agreed! Fortunately the new receptionist agreed to change it back to the price we had agreed. In the evening, we got back to the hotel to find that rather than moving us to a similar room, they had moved us to a cell-like room with one small, high window, cobwebs on the ceiling and by the bed, and a cupboard by the bed full of cleaning products which wouldn't shut properly. The room stank of smoke. We were obviously furious that they had moved us to such an awful room - perhaps this was because we had demanded a discount?? So, we then negotiated a further discount with a new receptionist but frankly would rather have moved to a different hotel if we weren't so exhausted. I would be very wary of making bookings with either of these hotels - their booking system is clearly in chaos and their customer service is dreaful. They told us so many lies and it should be said that i'm fluent in Italian and so probably picked up on a lot more that was being said than non-Italian speakers would have. The receptionist at Locanda Salieri also told us that in order to give us a room, they rang up and cancelled a different guest who was about to arrive, and so it's pretty clear that they are very unreliable and do not honour bookings.

Reviews.Title: “the strategic traveller stop in venice-perfecto”
Reviews.Author: messagero
Reviews.Content: from the airport or train, you can maximise your time in `venice by staying here. why spend a hour struggling through crowds with your suitcase, when you can throw it in the door of this perfectly located, amazingly priced and sparkling clean little one star treasure? you are then free to travel, light explore the city, for pleasure or for business and be able to make a very easy connection for departure. i have used this hotel for over a year for various trips and last time it was so perfect i decided to share it with trip advisor. i have seen a lot of one stars in venice- no comparison-some are downright scary, trust me, this is a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl1925
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights and didn't want to leave. I had reserved a budget room for 70 euro per night. I left my bag with them in the morning because I was going on an all day trip to the Dolomites. When I got back, reception gave me a key and sent me upstairs. I opened the door to this beautiful spacious room and thought there had been a mistake, even though my bag had been delivered. I went back downstairs and spoke with reception. He told me I had been upgraded at no charge to a 100 euro room. I was ecstatic. This room (#4 ) had a king bed, private bathroom, TV, and, wait for it, a canal view balcony! I had dreamed of this room but never expected to see it on my budget. I was in heaven. It had marble floors and walls, armoire, desk, luggage rack, large mirror in entryway, two night stands, a chair and a phone. The bathroom had a marbled shower, pedestal sink, mirror, hair dryer, and towel rack. It looked newly renovated. It was spotless with the exception of a long black hair in the sink. The balcony was facing a little canal that had light traffic that included gondolas. There was a double wrought iron planter containing red geraniums, and shutters. If you look to your left, you will see church bells that peal on the hour. It was an utterly charming, peaceful and beautiful setting. The 24-hour reception from the first minute was welcoming and friendly and spoke English well. I was given a Venice map without asking. There was a thoughtful shelf of books for guests as well as a full umbrella stand. There are 12 rooms on three floors. To get a view ask for numbers 3, 4, 7, 8, 11, or 12. Breakfast is included and is served from 8:30-9:30 in the Ristorante Ribo next door. There is garden dining for lunch and dinner here which looked very inviting, but I ate elsewhere. Hotel is in the Santa Croce district just minutes from Piazzale Roma, so it's a perfect location to get the buses and vaparettos. I loved this hotel and would not stay anywhere else if I came back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Hollandgrandpa
Reviews.Content: This one star hotel was a nice surprise. The staff spoke enough English to make us feel comfortable. It is easily accessible from the train station and Piazzale Roma where the airport bus arrives. It is a 15 minute walk to Rialto and 30 minute walk to San Marco Piazza. We enjoyed the walks and getting back to our hotel in a quiet neighborhood. We had a room with a very small balcony on the canal, which I would highly recommend. It is definitely worth the extra cost. The gondolas regularly went by with accordion players and vocalists adding to the ambience. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was decent size but the lighting was not good. The room was typical small European but ours had an extra twin bed.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to live Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sisma76
Reviews.Content: The rooms are confortable, clean and romantic, just opening the windows you can see the laguna!An the location is perfect to live Venice you just need to walk a bit and you will be everywhere in Venice.The staff are nice and very friendly.Book there!;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Great staff. Great price.”
Reviews.Author: Lorena82
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Locanda Salieri and I have to say it was the best election we made. Great location (about 100 meters from Piazzale Roma, the last point where you can arrive by bus for about 6 euros, otherwise you have to take a water taxi, which costs about 70 euros).The gentlemen at the front desk really made us feel like at home, so polite and helpful. The breakfast was great, with variety of food and drinks, the room was clean and nice and also the private bathroom. I definitely reccomend this Hotel to stay. It has the price of a hostel, with a great service and location.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmDafna
Reviews.Content: Locanda Salieri was the sane choice among Venice's insanely expensive hotels. It was clean and cute, in a good location. Staff were nice and friendly. We ordered a room with a view to the canal, which was beautiful and it was nice to hear the acordions on the gonfolas that passed by. When we booked the hotel we ordered a package with a gondola trip with Alex, but when we arrived we were told that she's on vacation. So we were a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveTea
Reviews.Content: Only a stroll away to Piazza Roma, the train station and car parks. You may ask for a room with the canal view too. 15 mins walk to the St Marcos Square. Around 6 to 7 O'clock in the evening, you may hear people singing on the Gondolas in the canal and it's a good experience. The room is quite but small. I found biscuit crumbs on the sheet. The shower drainage is bad. Only recommend for the budget stay and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: cagdas
Reviews.Content: Locanda Salieri was the perfect choice for us because; -It is five minutes to Bus/train Stations so you don't have to carry your luggage up and down the little bridges for long. Also they kindly kept our luggages until midnight on the day we took the train to Rome. - It is on a "fondamenta" which means it has a great canal view but not in a crammed little canal. - We loved walking through the charming little streets and it was about 20 mins walk to centre- St Marco etc. - There were more locals around then tourists. - It's cheap for Venice standards but clean -i mean really clean-and comfortable. - Staff are very friendly and helpful. We would stay there next time although: - Breakfast becomes a bit boring after second day. - Rooms are bit on the small side (but watching the canal traffic from your bed is a real treat) There are lots of market stalls, grocery shops etc around. No need to buy or carry water with you as Venice has hundreds of drinkable water fountains, we gave up our bottles even though it was a scorching hot day. Last but not least, if you are going to hire a gondola make sure it's the Venice's only Gondoliera Alexandra's.It's a beatiful gondola, sparkling clean, she's very skilled and took us to "real Venice" as well as touristy parts. She charges the standard rate, and throws in a bottle of sparkling wine -which was delicious. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “From venice with love”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveler76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 night from the 17th of september, we had a pretty large room with a canal view. Staff was nice and helpsome. The breakfast was nothing fancy but worked good as a starter until lunch each day. The location is good, close to coop supermarket in P.Roma where we bought a 5 liter bag in box wine for the amazing prize of 5.24 euro. During our stay we walked everywhere, no need to buy a vaporetto pass. Save the money for something else instead. Campo San Margarita is about 4 min walk from the hotell, a place we visited each day for spritz and icecream and just watching people. We eat at the following places during our stay. * Resturant In Campio Total cost, XL beers and pasta with bread for 32 euros. * Trattoria San Traverso Total cost, 2 beers, 2 spritzers, 2 pasta with bread for 32 euros. *Resturante Dona Onesta Had had way to many spritzers this day to remeber prizes. Also visited The Devils forrest, great place with a great crew. I had expected the weekend to become expensive but it turned out that if u look around u can really lower your prizes. We bought wine from coop, some bread and cheese from BILA. Lots of icecream from several places, eat pizza and drank beers and spritzers all over town. Total cost including transport for the stay reached 260 euros for us both. Venice is a really lovely town with its canals and old buildings. I wanna go soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Get a canal view room”
Reviews.Author: thumper1
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on Booking.com and spent the extra euros for a canal view room. It was worth it to watch and hear the gondolas as they went by. The view was good and it was close to the train station and grand canal. Breakfast buffet was cold foods -- ham and cheese and rolls. There was juice and hot drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The smart choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jdjess
Reviews.Content: We loved the reasonable hotel fee, spacious and authentically-furnished room (heavy wooden pieces), modern bathroom, and accessibility. Very clean and convenient. No elevators though, but this helps keep the price of the hotel down I guess. Hearty European breakfast of bread, ham, jams etc was served at the restaurant beside it (which incidentally serves amazing pasta and wine, frequented by locals for dinner). It was a 5-10 minute walk from the bus station, wheeling our suitcases. It takes a little longer to walk to the train station. To get to the train station, because we refused to take the expensive water taxis, we had to lug our suitcases on staired bridges, but it was worth the savings. Since it was near the bus and train stations, it was very easy to tour Venice as vaporetto (water buses?) stations were located in the bus and train stations too. The hotel is situated in the less picturesque area of Venice, but it wasn't a problem as Venice is pretty small and it was interesting to walk through the interesting narrow streets to get to San Marco, the opera, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to experience Venice”
Reviews.Author: WMare
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this small hotel. Accomodations were immaculate and bathroom was modern. Our room overlooked a canal in which we saw gondolas complete with accordian players. The included breakfast was next door in a quaint restaurant. Staff was extremely helpful. It is a very easy 5 minute walk from the train station. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: dixwimby
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice several times and try to stay at different locations each trip. In November 2007 we stayed at the Locanda Salieri after reviewing it on tripadvisor. This was a super little hotel. for our north american cousins. Venice is an expensive place to stay. Also the size of the room will be small, in some cases very small unless paying 400+ euros a night, then you can get a reasonable size room. The Salieri is very close to the bus terminus [pizzale Roma] and vaperetto [public water taxi's] less than 10 minutes walk, over 2 bridges. the Locanda is by a canal and has a small reception area [tiny] up some stairs are the rooms, so if you have difficulty in walking up stairs this is not for you. our room was on the first floor which was a normal size room for venice. very clean. small bathroom with shower, toilet and bidet. good hot water from the shower. we were bed and breakfast. breakfast was held in the next door ribo restaurant. this had a very large garden patio at the back. buffet breakfast with a hot choice. plenty of variety to start the walking day. The staff were very friendly at both the locanda and restaurant. we had dinner at the restaurant on one of our evenings. It was very good with a much more extensive toscana and venetian menu [than you will find in many venice bistro's and restaurants] with a wonderful wine list. [it has a small seperate wine area where we had some antipasta for late lunch and a super bottle of 2003 Valpolicella]. If you like chocolate have the chocolate souffle- it is to die for. The Locanda is in easy walking distance for the Friari; Campo Margherita ; Railway station. I Would recommend both the Locanda and the restaurant. Will stay again on one of your trips..

Reviews.Title: “Basically Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: cupdecha
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice this week, and booked into the Salieri as it was much cheaper than many hotels in Venice. We didn't expect much from it, but it exceeded our expectations! Our room was spotless, and was cleaned everyday. The cleaner was slightly overzealous about tidyness however as she did like to move our things around and put them in cupboards and drawers. The staff on the door were superbly helpful as well, and all spoke English well enough to make up for our lack of Italian! But the location was excellent too. It's very close to the bus and train station so it was easy to find - something that cannot be taken for granted in this maze of a city! It was a trek to get to St Marks however, but actually this forced us to explore more of the city. We stumbled across Santa Margarita Square, 5 mins from the hotel, and then went there every night because it was full of life - the local students hang out in the area. All in all, the Salieri is basic, but it is clean, friendly and convenient. Above all it is ideal for people who want to see the city on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, exellent staff”
Reviews.Author: djhx777
Reviews.Content: Rooms cleaned on a daily basis to a high standard and clean towels daily. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had a problem during our stay â€˜not related to the hotelâ€™ but the staff and hotel owner went out of their way to help. Canâ€™t thank them enough. A highly recommended hotel, great value for money. The Gondola trip organised by the hotel is a must, this is a lot cheaper than other gondola trips with bottle of wine thrown in. This is with the only female gondolier in Venice and is more personal than the more commercial gondolier trips. The breakfast served in the adjacent restaurant was simple but adequet and set you up for the active day ahead. This was our second trip to Venice and we will be going back later in the year, and will defiantly use this hotel again and have already passed details to friends who are planning a trip to Venice. Will add photos later

Reviews.Title: “Great but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Canada_blossom_2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed in triple room #2, over looking the 'garden'. Well the garden is now their restaurant 'Libo'. Noisy while open 8:00-23:30. Room is besic, tidy but small, std for Venice. Excellent location, 5 min walk from train/bus station. Pick room on Minotto / canal side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sallyfix
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Salieri is an excellent choice for those people staying in Venice who don't want to fork out a vast amount of money on a hotel room in which they will only spend a few hours per day. In relation to other hotels in the city, this is very good value indeed. Ignore the one star rating, I think this is largely meaningless in a city where room prices are so out of tune with the rest of the world! The hotel itself is within a very short distance from the bus and railway stations - about 5-10 minutes walk depending on whether you are carrying heavy cases or not! It is very close to the Grand Canal and therefore you are only a boat ride away from all the sights in Venice - if you don't want to walk everywhere. Our room was great, basic but very clean and the bathroom was nice, with a large shower. We asked for a room with a canal view and I think these rooms are bigger than the others. I think rooms 3 and 4 are the best ones to have if they are available. The breakfast was a bit disappointing but in my experience, Italian hotel breakfasts almost always are. The coffee bordered on the vile (as I have always found in hotels in Italy) which is unforgiveable given how delicious it is in the cafes around town. Italian hoteliers should hang their heads in shame!! This is a minor matter though and I wouldn't let this put me off. I would certainly return here without hesitation and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: bbencus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in November of 2006 for two nights with a friend, after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is clean, has an excellent location (close to the bus station, lively but not overcrowded area) and provides good value for money. The room was charming but very small, although I had no problems with that, it also had â€œcanal viewâ€� and it was really very nice. The staff was friendly. I would gladly stay again and recommend this hotel wholeheartedly to those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Never_om
Reviews.Content: You generally get what you pay for but in this case you get a bit more .... Let's get this right - 5 minutes walk from the bus station (OK and 2 bridges!) which is 3 Euros from the airport. Balcony overlooking a canal, a reasonable breakfast - which keeps you going to lunch, an en suite - cleaned room and towells every day. You only sleep here as you are out explroing all day - We stayed here for 4 nights and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value at the Salieri”
Reviews.Author: NorthYorkshireMike
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, comfortable and quiet. Breakfasts were fine although we avoided ham and cheese for a few days on our return home. However, on our first evening we went in to the restaurant for dinner at 7.30pm to be told that they were fully booked for the evening. We were about to leave when the hotel manager (?) owner(?) intervened and told us we could eat provided we left by 8.30. He pressed us to stay so we had one course and a bottle of wine. When the head waiter presented the bill he whispered in my ear that 'service is not included sir', not the most subtle form of begging. This, despite the statement that service is included at the bottom of the menu. The food was fine though slightly expensive. There are plenty of other options within a five minute walk (though avoid the tre ponti).

Reviews.Title: “Not a first choice but not horrible”
Reviews.Author: Ronda123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to P. Roma which is why we booked it. However you do have to carry your luggage over some bridges to get to it and it did take us some work to actually find it. The hotel is shabby (not shabby chic, but just shabby). The furnishings look really bad. But the bathroom was very clean. We had a canal view which wasn't bad. It was very noisy at night, though. All in all, not horrible and well priced but not a first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, simple”
Reviews.Author: downinit
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable hotel in Venice, and this place did not disappoint me. I was an easy walk from the train station, maybe 5 minutes and 1 big bridge. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was decent, typical of what most hotels in Europe give. The room was more than large enough for 2 people with luggage. We had a canal view room with a small balcony overlooking the minor canal in front of the hotel. There is no elevator, so if you don't like stairs, look elsewhere. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay, and if I ever go back to Venice, I would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: twotickets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this little locanda for four nights. We were pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to find from the Piazzale Roma which is where the coach stops coming from Marco Polo. Also nice and close to the train station which was great as we had an early morning train to catch to Florence. We are in our 50's and had a room at the front on the second floor. If we can manage those stairs, anybody can! The bed was a nice big, comfortable 5 foot one so that made the room look even smaller than it actually was. There was a wardrobe and space for cases - also a TV which only had Italian stations. The shower room was small but perfectly formed and beautifully fitted out as only the Italians can - the surprise was the fold down bidet under the sink unit! Once seen never forgotten. The staff were very pleasant and we managed to communicate just fine despite the language difference. Breakfast in the restaurant next door was again very pleasant -- fresh italian-style croissants and serve yourself juice, coffee, etc. The highlight each evening as we got ready to go out for dinner was a candlelit procession of gondolas passing along the canal beneath our window, complete with singer. Lovely. We loved Venice so much we plan a return trip and will definitely book here again. Excellent value for money. Don't be put off by the 1 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Stay In 2003.”
Reviews.Author: vaszary
Reviews.Content: Was a pleasant two night stay. Was worth the price even though free breakfast was sorely lacking. Treated nice by friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “accomplished what it had to”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am only 18 and my girl friend who I went with was 18. We just wanted a nice hotel at a cheap price where we could enjoy our stay. We didn't need anything luxiourous especially since we didn't spend most of our time at the hotel anyways. If this is you, then Locanda Salieri is definitely a possible hotel. The room was smaller than other hotels that we had stayed in, but still fine. Large enough for the bed and our suit cases. There was AC, and although it wasnt great, it was noticeable. The breakfast was sufficient. The hotel was very cheap, that was a plus, and it was near the train station. You wouldnt' want to walk from the hotel to San Marco's, although we did several times because we are young and its not a big deal, but you can catch a vaporetto at the train station area anyways. The people were very friendly and around all night. I have to say that the two hotels we stayed in previously were very nice, better than we expected, so maybe this one just appeared avg in comparison, when really, for a european hotel, we were lucky to have had it. It only got a 1 star rating, and that was probably because of little things like it being a 3 floor hotel with no elevator. I could see how that might be a burden for some people, but again, us being young, we could handle it. Just weigh your options, but venice is a tough place to find cheap hotels in. There was no shame in staying in this hotel, and don't be scared by the 1 star rating. It was clean, comfortabl, and we didnt have any problems. If you want nicer, it will jsut cost you more, plain and simple.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Locanda Salieri
